required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pectus ESC Outcomes and Comparative Effectiveness Study
clinical_study.official_title: Pragmatic Study Comparing Outcomes of Multimodal Epidural and Erector Spinae Catheter Pain Protocols After Pectus Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators hypothesize that Erector spinae catheter pain management protocol would allow patients to have earlier and more effective rehabilitation with decreased length of hospital stay. The aims are to compare LOS between the two groups (epidural and ES groups). Secondary aims are to compare recovery outcomes (mobilization time), time required to do the blocks, pain scores and opioid use during hospitalization and on follow up after discharge until Pain clinic visit, side effects, family satisfaction and readmissions among the two groups. In addition, in-hospital and post-discharge outcomes in subjects who received ESP protocol will be studied.

detailed_description.textblock: Retrospective study - Electronic medical records of consecutive patients who underwent pectus surgery between January and December of 2019 (epidural protocol) and those who underwent same procedure between June 2020 to May 2021, will be evaluated. Covariates and outcomes described in sections below will be recorded from EMR. The data included records from flowsheets, pain team notes based on follow up questionnaires administered by phone after discharge until after ESP catheters were removed, as well as pain clinic notes.

primary_outcome.description: Date of surgery to hospital discharge

primary_outcome.time_frame: After surgery in-hospital, phone calls until POD6, pain clinic and surgery clinic postop visit (within 4 weeks after surgery)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After surgery in-hospital, phone calls until POD6, pain clinic and surgery clinic postop visit (within 4 weeks after surgery)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain scores postoperative and opioid/benzodiazepine use

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After surgery in-hospital, phone calls until POD6, pain clinic and surgery clinic postop visit (within 4 weeks after surgery)
secondary_outcome.description: ED visit, readmission, numbness, infection, LA toxicity etc.

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent Nuss procedure under epidural protocol (between January and December of 2019)
Patients who underwent Nuss procedure using ESP catheter protocol (June 2020 to April 2021)

intervention.description: Patients either received multimodal epidural or ESP protocol

study_pop.textblock: Patient with pectus excavatum who underwent Nuss procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age>8 years
- Diagnosis of pectus excavatum who underwent Nuss procedure
- Pain regimen included either epidural catheter or ES catheters
Exclusion Criteria:
- Developmental delay
- prior pectus repair
- concomitant procedures
